page.title: 20The Pilgrim's Way at Gatton
page.content: { Walking, hiking}etc. are very popular pass-times in the area and there are many public footpaths and bridleways. The Pilgrim's way is one. Although the school grounds at {Gatton Park}are private, the public is allowed to walk through on the footpath.{The North Downs Way}is the same as the Pilgims Way. It is now a road through the school, the course of it has been altered because of the school buildings. The North Downs Way turns back into a muddy footpath after{Rocky Lane,}As it goes past Whitehall Farm with its strawberry fields. The footpath has not been changed into roads there because it goes over fields and we need the fields to grow fruit and vegetables - and access is not needed at this point for vehicles.
